channel.title: Patrick Lehmann - Articles & Insights
channel.description: Exploring AI collaboration, work-life balance, faith-driven development, and lessons learned from modern software engineering

item.title: You Can Love the Craft Without Loving the Culture
item.description: Six and a half years of writing code taught me this: you can love software engineering while having zero patience for the 'ackshually' crowd. And the same principle applies to theology. A reflection on loving your craft without the pretension.
item.author: contact@patricklehmann.io (Patrick Lehmann)

item.title: I Get Why People Are Leaving Tech
item.description: Six and a half years ago, tech changed my life. Now I'm watching talented people walk away from the industry, and honestly? I understand why. A reflection on the current state of the American tech job market and what it means for those still fighting to break in or stay in.
item.author: contact@patricklehmann.io (Patrick Lehmann)

item.title: From TypeScript to C# .NET: A Developer's Transition Guide
item.description: How CoStar Group's acquisition of homes.com forced me to transition from TypeScript to C# .NET. The reality check, the learning curve, and what actually worked in making the switch.
item.author: contact@patricklehmann.io (Patrick Lehmann)

item.title: From Natural Gas to .NET: What Blue Collar Work Taught Me About Clean Code
item.description: How six years of transitioning from 70+ hour weeks in natural gas to C# development taught me that blue collar work habits translate directly to writing better, cleaner code.
item.author: contact@patricklehmann.io (Patrick Lehmann)

item.title: Coding as Worship: How Programming Reflects God's Creative Nature
item.description: Exploring the spiritual parallels between programming and divine creation. How writing code reflects being made in the image of a Creator God who spoke the universe into existence.
item.author: contact@patricklehmann.io (Patrick Lehmann)

item.title: The One Phrase That Transformed How I Work with AI (And It's Probably Not What You Think)
item.description: How a simple phrase changed my entire approach to AI collaboration, turning AI from a code-generating vending machine into a thoughtful colleague.
item.author: contact@patricklehmann.io (Patrick Lehmann)

item.title: How AI Helps Me Code Smarter, Not Harder (So I Can Actually Be Present for What Matters)
item.description: How AI tools like GitHub Copilot and Claude Code help me maintain strict 40-hour work weeks while delivering quality code. The secret to being fully present for family time.
item.author: contact@patricklehmann.io (Patrick Lehmann)
